item.title: M6A review
item.description:
1. Definition and basic concepts

![[Pasted image 20250608143245.png]]

  • ~25% of mammalian mRNAs contain m6A
  • m6A was found in UTR3’ and near stop codons of transcripts that regulate differentiation and development
  • best characterized protein family which binds to m6A: YTH family

2. Basic molecular function (fig 1,2)

  • 2.1 pre-RNA splicing and nuclear export

    • 2.1.1 m6A affact alternative splicing : a.directly b.indirectly

      • a.directly: recruiting SRSF3 –> exon retention
      • b.indirect: exposing - HNRNPC –> exon retention

    • 2.1.2 m6A facilitate shuttling of mRNAs to the cytoplasm for translation

  • 2.2 mRNA degradation and stability

    • **strong context dependence
    • ==futrue work== need to determine what additional factor determine whether the transcript need to degradate or stablize

  • 2.3 mRNA translation

    • 5’ UTR m6A: initiation (cap-indepedent)
    • 3’ UTR: enhance translation (cap-dependent)
    • fact shows m6A can inhibit tRNA interaction thereby affacting elongatioin rate

  • 2.4 refines ribosome binding

    • only 2 conserved position are methylated:
      • 18s rRNA:1832
      • 28s rRNA:4220
    • function：induce the translation specificity under different context

  • 2.5 micro RNA processing

  • 2.6 circRNA production and translation

  • 2.7 Spliceosome regulation

    • regulate snRNAs to facilitate spliceosome assembly

3. Chomatin and genome intergrity (fig 3)

  • 3.1 pre-mRNA crosstalk with chromatin modification

    • providing an extensive layer of gene expression regulating
    • positive feedback example:
      • m⁶A的共沉积：
        METTL14识别活跃转录区的H3K36me3标记 → 招募METTL3 → 在新生RNA上即时添加m⁶A修饰。
      • H3K9me2的擦除：
        新生RNA的m⁶A修饰反过来招募去甲基化酶（如KDM3B），移除抑制性标记H3K9me2，维持染色质开放状态。

  • 3.2 regulate lncRNA

    • Xist lncRNA contain m6A can silence gene on X chromasome
    • can change lncRNAs’ formation –> downstream

  • 3.3 degradate carRNA

    • carRNA can increase chromatin acsessibility
    • m6A can facilitate chromatin reorganization to regulate the appropriate suppression of retrotransposons to safe guard genome stability

  • 3.4 promote genome stability at R-loops

    • R-loops: DNA-RNA complex, function for transcription intiation and elongation
    • prevent genome from degredation

4. m6A in development and differentiation (fig 4)

  • 4.1 facilitate ES cell self-renewal and differentiation

    • Nanog SOX2 KLF4 can maintain pluripotency
    • m6A on those pluripotency factors’ mRNA can induce degradation thereby close the pluripotency fate and push the cell into differentiation.

  • 4.2 facilitate clearance of maternal mRNAs

    • m6A and YTHDF2 recruit protein for degradation maternal mRNA (1/3 contain m6A)

  • 4.3 regulate adult stem-cell differentiation
